PROJECT PREPARATORY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE 
 
A.  Justification 
1.  The Toktogul Rehabilitation Project Phase 2 (the Project) aims to further rehabilitate 
Toktogul  hydroelectric  power  plant  (HPP)  by  replacing  two  turbine-generator  units  and 
associated auxiliary systems, and conduct financial audit and corporate governance review of 
the power sector companies. Ongoing works (Phase1) cover rehabilitation of priority secondary 
mechanical and electrical equipment. The final Phase 3 will cover the remaining two turbine-
generator units and civil structure repairs. A project preparatory technical assistance (PPTA) will 
conduct Project due diligence 
 
2.   The PPTA is necessary due to the Project urgency and complexity. There is a need for 
expertise from competent international and national consultants to assist the executing agency, 
Open Joint Stock Company Electric Power Plants (EPP), in preparing the Project.

C.  Cost Estimate and Proposed Financing Arrangement  
4.  The PPTA is estimated to cost $750,000 equivalent, of which $700,000 will be financed 
on a grant basis by the Asian Development Bank’s (ADB) Technical Assistance Special Fund 
(TASF-V). The detailed cost estimate is presented in Table A4.2.

D.  Consulting Services 
5.  The PPTA consultant will be a firm. There are 10 positions for international (17 person-
months) and national consultants (18 persons-months).

6.  It  is  proposed  to  recruit  the  Phase  1  PPTA  consultant  and  the  Phase  1  Project 
Implementation Consultant to be the PPTA consultant for the Project. Single-source selection 
method will be used to recruit Fichtner Gmbh & Co. KG of Germany (Fichtner) using ADB grant 
fund of $0.7 million. The justifications for the single-source selection recruitment method are as 
follows: 
 
(i)  PPTA  for  Phase  1  included  an  assessment  of  future  phases  of  the  overall 
program. PPTA for Phases 2 is a natural continuation of Phase 1 PPTA work 
already carried out by Fichtner.  
(ii)  Fichtner  is  currently  working  as  Phase  1  project  implementation  consultant.  
Scheduling and scoping of Phases 2 and 3 need to be coordinated with Phase 1 
work  to  ensure  no  overlap  of  contractors  working  on  site  and  no  scope 
under/overlap. A single consultant should prepare the overall program. 
(iii)  The government has requested that the Project be expedited and that advance 
contracting is undertaken. Bidding documents for the Project should be issued, 
while bids for Phase 1 are under evaluation. Separate consulting firms dealing 
with EPP at the same time will complicate due diligence and implementation.

E.  Implementation Arrangements 
7.  EPP will be executing agency for the PPTA. An existing project implementation unit at 
EPP will be the project coordinating unit. The consultant will work closely with the project 
implementation unit.   
 
8.  EPP will assist the consultants in data gathering, preliminary analysis, and report writing. 
EPP will provide all necessary assistance to the consultants in liaising with other government 
ministries  and  agencies.  The  executing  agency  will  provide  and  make  available  to  the 
consultants, free of charge, the following facilities, services, equipment, materials, documents 
and information as required by the consultants for carrying out the PPTA. 
(i)  counterpart staff/technical support; 
(ii)  office space, sufficient office space for the consultant team, and has national and 
international telephone lines, electricity and air conditioning/heating and internet 
connections;

(iii)  office  furniture,  desks,  office  chairs,  book  shelves/cabinets  adequate  to 
accommodate the full complement of international and local consultants; and 
(iv)  organizational support: assistance in all arrangement for workshops, meetings, and 
field visits and access to required data, maps and other relevant information. 
 
9.  All  disbursements  under  the  TA  will  be  made  in  accordance  with  the  Technical 
Assistance Disbursement Handbook (2010, as amended).
 
 
10.  The  consultant  will  be  responsible  for  personal  computer  and  other  facilities  for 
producing reports.
